a6o3wg.question: When operating on the Standby Pack Controls, what temperatures will the packs be producing?

options.text: An average temperature for the two cabin zones.
The trim air modulating valves close so no pack air is provided to the two cabin zones, only re-circulated air is provided.
Left pack produces 18 degrees C, right pack produces 22 degrees C.
The flight deck required temperature will also be provided to the passenger cabin.

j7k2b.question: Which systems use engine bleed air during operation?

options.text: Engine starting, air conditioning, cabin pressurisation, engine and wing anti-icing, hydraulic, water.
Engine and wing anti-icing, engine starting, cabin pressurisation, hydraulic reservoir pressurisation.
Engine and wing anti-icing, air conditioning, cabin pressurisation, hydraulic reservoir pressurisation.
Engine and wing anti-icing, engine starting, air conditioning, cabin pressurisation, hydraulic reservoir pressurisation.

explanation:
### TRIP RESET Switch

- resets BLEED TRIP OFF, PACK or ZONE TEMP lights

- related engine bleed air valve opens, or related pack valve opens, or related trim air modulating valve opens

hmkql.question: The TRIP RESET switch is pushed to reset a PACK, WING-BODY OVERHEAT and BLEED TRIP OFF, it isolates the associated valve and extinguishes the alert.

i7omg.question: If all zone and primary pack controls fail, how is cabin temperatures controlled?

options.text: The last settings before the failure will be maintained until the packs are selected OFF.
The cabin temperatures cannot be controlled in this situation.
The standby pack controls command the packs to produce the average temperature demand of the 2 passenger cabin zones.
A fixed cabin temperature will be produced in this situation - 24 degrees C from the left pack, and 18 degrees C from the right pack.

ho68d.question: The APU is capable of supplying bleed air for two packs on the ground, or one pack in flight.

obags.question: If all Temperature Selectors are positioned OFF, the pack controls will cause the packs to produce which fixed temperatures?

options.text: Left Pack, 24 degrees Centigrade.  Right Pack, 18 degrees Centigrade.
Left Pack, 20 degrees Centigrade.  Right Pack, 22 degrees Centigrade.
Left Pack, 18 degrees Centigrade.  Right Pack, 24 degrees Centigrade.
Left Pack, 22 degrees Centigrade.  Right Pack, 20 degrees Centigrade.

u24a1.question: Engine bleed air pressure is controlled by means of the bleed air valve which acts as both a shutoff and pressure regulating valve.

iz4jv.question: What is the primary function of the recirculation fans?

options.text: To provide standby air conditioning if the packs fail.
Reduce engine bleed air demand and load on the packs.
Recirculate cabin air to allow it to be filtered to remove contaminants as it passes through the recirculation fan HEPA filters.
Recirculate the air from the passenger cabin the provide heating for the forward cargo compartment

y1wpo.question: Conditioned air from the left hand pack flows directly to the Flight Deck from the Mix Manifold.

wd9mb.question: The packs produce the coolest temperature selected in any of the zones, with the other zones temperature controlled by adding hot trim air to produce the required temperature.

fpnkb.question: How many Trim Air Pressure Regulators are there in the Air Conditioning system?

options.text: There are no Trim Air Pressure Regulators, only Trim Air Modulating valves.

79c2q.question: The differential pressure of the cabin is limited by a pressure relief system - which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: There is a negative pressure relief valve, which limits the cabin pressure to 9.1 psi above ambient.
There is an outflow valve which opens when cabin pressure reaches 9.1 psi above ambient.
There are two negative pressure relief valves, which limit the cabin pressure to 9.1 psi above ambient.
There are two pressure relief valves which limit differential pressure to 9.1 psi.

m4h2n.question: What is the result if all temperature zone selectors are positioned to OFF?

options.text: The right pack will produce a fixed temperature of 75 degrees Fahrenheit, and the left pack will produce a fixed temperature of 65 degrees Fahrenheit.
Left pack will produce 24 degrees centigrade and right pack will produce 18 degrees centigrade.
The packs will attempt to maintain an average temperature across all zones.

eghyy.question: Where are the wing-body overheat sensors located?

options.text: Engine struts, wing leading edge slats, air conditioning bays, APU duct, keel beam.
Engine struts, wing inboard leading edges, air conditioning bays, APU bleed duct, keel beam.
Engine cowling lips, wing leading edge slats, air conditioning bays, APU compartment, keel beam.
Engine cowl lips, wing leading edge slats, air conditioning bays, electronic equipment bay, APU bleed duct.

explanation: Bleed air is taken from **stage 5** from the **low pressure** compressor and **stage 9** of the **high pressure compressor**.

f4zwnj.question: Bleed air is taken from stage 4 and stage 10 of the high pressure compressor.

f4zwng.question: Bleed air is taken from stage 5 and stage 9 of the high pressure compressor.

f4zWnb.question: Bleed air is taken from stage 5 from the low pressure compressor and stage 9 of the high pressure compressor.

options.text: Bleed air is constantly provided from stage 5 and stage 9 of the compressor.
Bleed air is only supplied from the 9th stage when the valve modulates open if bleed air requirement is greater than the 5th stage alone can supply.
Bleed air is only supplied from the 5th stage when the valve modulates open if bleed air requirement is greater than the 9th stage alone can supply.

pgvwc.question: What is the result if one pack fails in-flight?

options.text: The remaining pack when selected to AUTO will be capable of maintaining pressurisation up to aircraft ceiling, only if all Zone Temperature Controllers are selected to OFF.
The remaining pack will not operate in HIGH flow.
The remaining pack is capable of maintaining pressurisation and acceptable cabin temperatures up to 41,000 feet.
The remaining pack will be capable of maintaining pressurisation up to the aircraft maximum certified ceiling, and will attempt to produce an average temperature across all cabin zones.

m8q0l.question: What is the function of the duel Bleed Light?

options.text: Illuminates to warn of possible backpressure whenever both engines are providing bleed air, and engines are at different thrust settings.
Illuminates whenever both APU and engines is running to warn of risk of backpressure to APU.
Illuminates when engine running and APU bleed air valve, engine bleed air valve, and isolation valve are in a position to permit possible backpressure of the APU.
Illuminates whenever pressure in APU rises above a pre-set value.

dmky7.question: Cabin pressurisation is controlled by the position of the Outflow Valve, but some air is also exhausted through the toilet and galley vents.
